CREATE PROCEDURE dbo.CreateExchangeRatesView7 AS
BEGIN
    -- Check if the view exists, and if so, drop it
    IF OBJECT_ID('dbo.exchange_rates', 'V') IS NOT NULL
    BEGIN
        DROP VIEW dbo.exchange_rates;
    END;

    -- Dynamically create the view
    DECLARE @sql NVARCHAR(MAX);

    SET @sql = '
    CREATE VIEW dbo.exchange_rates AS
    -- USD Data with the correct JSON parsing and holiday flag
    SELECT
        usd.upload_dt AS collection_dt_timestamp,
        ''USD'' AS base,
        j.[key] AS currency,  -- Currency key (e.g., AED, AFN, etc.)
        CAST(j.[value] AS NUMERIC(10, 4)) AS rate,  -- Rate value
        CASE
            WHEN h.event_date IS NOT NULL THEN h.holiday_description
            ELSE NULL
        END AS is_holiday
    FROM
        source_data_USD usd
        CROSS APPLY OPENJSON(usd.api_data)  -- Parse the JSON data
        WITH ([key] NVARCHAR(100), [value] NUMERIC(10, 4)) AS j  -- Schema for the JSON object
        LEFT JOIN be_holidays h 
            ON h.event_date = CAST(usd.upload_dt AS DATE)  -- Match date properly

    UNION ALL

    -- EUR Data with the holiday flag and proper join
    SELECT
        eur.upload_dt AS collection_dt_timestamp,
        ''EUR'' AS base,
        eur.currency,
        eur.rate,
        CASE
            WHEN h.event_date IS NOT NULL THEN h.holiday_description
            ELSE NULL
        END AS is_holiday
    FROM
        source_data_EUR eur
        LEFT JOIN be_holidays h 
            ON h.event_date = CAST(eur.upload_dt AS DATE);  -- Match date properly';

    EXEC sp_executesql @sql;  -- Execute the dynamic SQL to create the view
END;
